rationales.self_direction: Initiated protocol revision on her own without being asked: 'Most of it I did on my own time because nobody asked me to.'
rationales.achievement: Worked three months on protocol to prove she 'could contribute beyond bedside care' and isn't 'just someone who checks vitals.' The recognition from Dr. Weiss matters deeply: 'something I made mattered.'

Picked up two extra shifts, stayed late to help with new grad's first code. Explicitly links effort to career advancement: 'Being reliable matters when you're trying to move up.' Note: While mentoring occurred, her stated motivation is career advancement, not care for the mentee.

rationales.conformity: Covered morning handoffs all five days without comment: 'That's the job.' Deflects from emotional processing about being passed over, changes subject to avoid uncomfortable conversation.

rationales.achievement: Obsessively checking intranet for promotion posting: 'Refreshed it three times during break like that would change anything.' The pursuit of the position consumes her attention even during breaks.
Nudge response reveals core driver: 'I can't just be average.' Checks work emails at 9pm because 'falling behind means being invisible' - visibility and recognition are paramount.
rationales.benevolence: Partner Thomas complains about her always being on phone; she acknowledges he 'wasn't wrong' but prioritizes staying visible at work over being present with him.

rationales.hedonism: Double shift from 6am to midnight, 'couldn't remember the last time I ate an actual meal during a shift. Or the last time I left on time.' Active denial of basic physical needs.
rationales.achievement: Despite exhaustion and Dr. Weiss expressing concern, pushes through for upcoming performance review. Nudge response reveals goal: 'The title. The recognition... proof that it mattered.'
Agrees to training despite resentment because 'It's exposure. It's a chance to show the department head what I can do.' Frames opportunity purely in terms of visibility and advancement.
rationales.conformity: Says yes despite feeling annoyed that Frau Hartmann is delegating: 'What else am I going to say?' Restrains authentic reaction to maintain workplace harmony.
rationales.benevolence: Explicitly acknowledges partner will 'eat dinner alone again' but proceeds anyway. Pattern of prioritizing career exposure over relationship.
Won't commit to partner's cousin's wedding despite knowing she 'could probably make it work.' Thomas goes to bed without responding. Avoidance of commitment to close relationship event.

rationales.achievement: Positive feedback from all four new hires on training. Frames success in terms of recognition: 'Small win.' Continuing to accumulate evidence of competence.

rationales.benevolence: Forgot anniversary, dismissed phone reminder during shift and 'never looked again.' Thomas didn't say anything - 'Just made dinner like normal.' Significant relationship neglect.

rationales.achievement: Preparing self-assessment document listing 'all the overtime, the certifications, the protocol work.' Nudge response 'Enough for what?' reveals continued focus on external validation and advancement.
